channel.title: Running a server on Mac?
channel.description:
I know its possible but how would I go about doing this?
And yes, I know Mac sucks.

item.title: Running a server on Mac?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Odd Fortune, post:3, topic:433681”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=536399.msg3921780#msg3921780 date=1329782711]

I know its possible but how would I go about doing this?

And yes, I know Mac sucks.

Just use your command line, and type in the commands manually.

All my RSPS i run/play on Linux, so it pretty much the same. Both Unix Systems.
[/quote]

Like the terminal? I still can’t figure it out. I wish there was tutorials on this stuff but there aren’t any and the ones I’ve found are outdated. Its all for PC.[/quote]

Im going to guess you have JAVA JDK + JRE installed.
And the system knows the commands ‘java’ and javac’.:

Step 1)
Open up the terminal.
You have to change to the directory of your .class files. Type this in:

cd /THE PATH OF YOUR .class FILES/

Step 2)
now that your in the path, (if its a basic 317 server) type in:

The server should now be online (if it doesn’t, open the ‘run.bat’ and copy and paste the JAVA line into the terminal)

Step 3)
open up a new tab, and do the same thing for the client.

To Compile)
go to the .java dir, and do

Post back if this dosnt work for you…

Read full topic

item.title: Running a server on Mac?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Java is platform independent. I believe the way you would do it on a Mac, is exactly the same as any *nix system.

Read full topic
